{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3423417,"name":"Ada T","username":"cmdada","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmdada/{size}/230870_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T19:20:40.198Z","cooked":"

Coming from driving swerve to a team without the resources for swerve, driving robot centric arcade drive felt pretty unintuitive and weird, so I had a somewhat dumb idea…

I’m not a very experienced programmer and nobody else on the team has ever worked on a FIRST bot, but the end result was surprisingly usable, and for now I’m planning on running it at KCMT. Due to not having high quality Xbox controllers we’re using my Phob (a heavily modified GameCube controller) but the code would work with minor changes for most controller types and control schemes. All the code is available in our GitHub repo and if you have any questions we’d be happy to answer them. I’ll add a video of it working tomorrow when we have more space to demo it

cmdada:

a heavily modified GameCube controller

How do you modify something thats already perfect? /J I find myself grabbing my USB GameCube controller when I have the choice. I prefer it for driving over Xbox 360 or Xbox one

The title sort of got me … how do you do field centric differential drive? If the robot is say at 45 degrees and you push the stick, a differential drive is going to have to turn before it can drive, right?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T20:37:19.815Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":190,"readers_count":189,"score":78.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":471192,"topic_slug":"team-1157-field-centric-differential-drive","display_username":"Joe Witcpalek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29802,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/team-1157-field-centric-differential-drive/471192/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3423452,"name":"Ada T","username":"cmdada","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmdada/{size}/230870_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T21:04:59.246Z","cooked":"

We use the right stick to turn, and after that the robot centric forwards and backwards is the direction field relative on the drive stick now, so instead of up and down on the stick being robot centric forwards and backwards it’s the field centric direction. sorry about the verbose explanation

also we can combine the motions like swerve it’s just inefficient, like spinning and pointing in a direction does go in that direction it just does it in arcs

Thanks for the reply.

I know before we switched to swerve someone wanted us to do “field oriented drive”. Part of how they described what they wanted to do, would have required the robot to go in directions it wasn’t capable of going.

Sounds like you’ve just accepted those limitations, so it sounds like a win for you.

This is an idea I had a while ago, and there is certainly some merit to it, as it would be very intuitive and almost exactly like a video game, which at this point is where most drivers (myself included) get their skill from.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-09-14T00:39:19.945Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":19.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471192,"topic_slug":"team-1157-field-centric-differential-drive","display_username":"Ada T","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50684,"username":"crueter","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60586,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1157 team captain, 2036 electrical lead 2024"},"post_url":"/t/team-1157-field-centric-differential-drive/471192/10","custom_user_title":"1157 team captain, 2036 electrical lead 2024","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3423512,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-14T00:45:42.865Z","cooked":"

I’m gonna be honest, this doesn’t make much sense to me at all. “Field centric” control doesn’t make any sense at all when dealing with a non-omnidirectional drivetrain type. “Vehicle centric” is the default for many things outside of FRC, including RC cars for example. It’s not that hard to learn, you just have to spend time doing it. I genuinely don’t understand how robot-centric is confusing to some.

Anyway, this isn’t an issue to be solved with software, but rather something to be solved with training/practice.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-09-14T00:45:42.865Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":64.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471192,"topic_slug":"team-1157-field-centric-differential-drive","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/team-1157-field-centric-differential-drive/471192/11","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3423527,"name":"Ada T","username":"cmdada","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmdada/{size}/230870_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-14T01:39:12.558Z","cooked":"

but it’s fun… /j

no anyways we will be switching to swerve hopefully immediately after KCMT so this way our driver will be somewhat practiced with field centric
